description
The root class.
The Type List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Type List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Type List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Name List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Name List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Type List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Type List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The Name List class provides a list of values and their value meanings.
The ASCII_Short_String_Collapsed class indicates a limited length, whitespace-collapsed string.

Access Rights Information: The information that identifies the access restrictions pertaining to the Content Information, including the legal framework, licensing terms, and access control. It contains the access and distribution conditions stated within the Submission Agreement, related to both preservation (by the OAIS) and final usage (by the Consumer). It also includes the specifications for the application of rights enforcement measures. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-16, figure 4-18

Archival Information Package (AIP): An Information Package, consisting of the Content Information and the associated Preservation Description Information (PDI), which is preserved within an OAIS. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-4, figure 4-1, figure 4-14, figure 4-15, figure 4-17, figure 4-18
An object made by a human being.
The Artifact_External_Reference class provides a reference, for example a bibliographic entry, to an artifact external to the system.
The Artifact_Internal_Reference class provides a link to an artifact existing within the system.
The Artifact_Type_Area is used to provide classification information for an artifact.
The Artifact_Type_Information is used to provide classification information for an artifact.
The Character Data Type class is the parent class for data types used to classify the values of attributes in class descriptions, i.e., product labels and character digital objects.
The Checksum_Area is used to provide information about Checksums and other mechanism used to ensure the integrity of the data object.
The Conceptual Object class defines a non-tangible object that is also not a digital object.  /source: /pds

Context Information: The information that documents the relationships of the Content Information to its environment. This includes why the Content Information was created and how it relates to other Content Information objects. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-16, figure 4-18
null
Data Object: Either a Physical Object or a Digital Object. /source:  ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-2, figure 4-10, figure 4-18
The Data Type class is the abstract parent class for several classes of data types. /source:
The Date_Time_Area is used to provide date and time information.
Digital Object: An object composed of a set of bit sequences. /source:  ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-10, figure 4-18
The Digital_Object_Handle class provides a Persistent Identifier for a digital object described by this label. The digital object must exist within the system.

Dissemination Information Package (DIP): An Information Package, derived from one or more AIPs, and sent by Archives to the Consumer in response to a request to the OAIS. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-4, figure 4-1, figure 4-14
null
A realm or range of personal knowledge, responsibility, etc.
The Domain_Area is used to provide formation about a specified sphere of activity or knowledge.
null

Fixity Information: The information which documents the mechanisms that ensure that the Content Information object has not been altered in an undocumented manner. An example is a Cyclical Redundancy Check (CRC) code for a file. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-16, figure 4-18
The organization of information according to preset specifications.
The Format_Type_Area is used to provide format information.
Identification Information: The information that is used to identify information objects. /source:/jsh
The Information_Architecture abstract class groups the information classes for the Data Archive Architecture.

Information Model: An information model is a representation of concepts, relationships, constraints, rules, and operations to specify data semantics for a chosen domain of discourse.  /source: /Lee, Y. T. 1999
Information Object: A Data Object together with its Representation Information. /source:  ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-2, figure 4-10, figure 4-12

Information Package: A logical container composed of optional Content Information and optional associated Preservation Description Information. Associated with this Information Package is Packaging Information used to delimit and identify the Content Information and Package Description information used to facilitate searches for the Content Information. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-13, figure 4-14
null
The Instrument class provides a description of a physical object that collects data.
The Instrument Host class provides a description of the physical object upon which an instrument is mounted.
A set of experiments and/or observations with a clearly defined purpose.
null
The Name_Type_List_Area is used to insert a Name or Type list into the Common model.
The Native_Area provides for external information and plugin.
null

Physical Object: An object (such as a moon rock, bio-specimen, microscope slide) with physically observable properties that represent information that is considered suitable for being adequately documented for preservation, distribution, and independent usage. /source:  ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-10, figure 4-18

Preservation Description Information (PDI): The information which is necessary for adequate preservation of the Content Information and which can be categorized as Provenance, Reference, Fixity, Context, and Access Rights Information. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-3, figure 4-12, figure 4-13, figure 4-15, figure 4-18
null

Provenance Information: The information that documents the history of the Content Information. This information tells the origin or source of the Content Information, any changes that may have taken place since it was originated, and who has had custody of it since it was originated. The Archive is responsible for creating and preserving Provenance Information from the point of Ingest; however, earlier Provenance Information should be provided by the Producer. Provenance Information adds to the evidence to support Authenticity. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-16, figure 4-18

Reference Information: The information that is used as an identifier for the Content Information. It also includes identifiers that allow outside systems to refer unambiguously to a particular Content Information. An example of Reference Information is an ISBN. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 4-16, figure 4-18

Representation Information: The information that maps a Data Object into more meaningful concepts. An example of Representation Information for a bit sequence which is a FITS file might consist of the FITS standard which defines the format plus a dictionary which defines the meaning in the file of keywords which are not part of the standard. Another example is JPEG software which is used to render a JPEG file; rendering the JPEG file as bits is not very meaningful to humans but the software, which embodies an understanding of the JPEG standard, maps the bits into pixels which can then be rendered as an image for human viewing. /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-2, figure 4-10, figure 4-12, figure 4-18
null

The Science_Investigation_Area is used to provide information about specific science missions, observing campaigns, and individual investigations that typically involve data collection using an instrument.

Submission Information Package (SIP): An Information Package that is delivered by the Producer to the OAIS for use in the construction or update of one or more AIPs and/or the associated Descriptive Information. (Note: According to PAIS, a producer prepares a MOT. However an Information Package is also allowed if an AIP is to be derived directly from a SIP.) /source: ISO_14721_2012 figure 2-4, figure 4-1, figure 4-14
null
null
The UTF8_Short_String_Collapsed class indicates a limited length, whitespace-collapsed string constrained to the UTF-8 character encoding.
